goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time. It can also help us identify any outliers or anomalies.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the reasons for flight cancellations and the frequency of each reason.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight routes?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the most popular flight routes and the frequency of flights on each route.

goals.question: What is the distribution of airline carriers?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the market share of each airline carrier and the frequency of flights operated by each carrier.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-3m.csv')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['fl_date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['fl_date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['fl_date'])]

# Create histogram of departure delay
sns.histplot(data=data, x='dep_delay', kde=False, color='blue')

# Add vertical line for median delay time
median_delay = data['dep_delay'].median()
plt.axvline(median_delay, color='red', linestyle='dashed', label=f'Median Delay: {median_delay:.2f} mins')

# Set chart title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?')
plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (mins)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')

# Add legend
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv('flights-3m.csv')

sns.scatterplot(x='distance', y='air_time', data=data)
plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?')
plt.xlabel('Distance')
plt.ylabel('Air Time')

plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-3m.csv')

# Bar chart of cancellation reasons
sns.countplot(x='CancellationCode', data=data, palette='Set2')
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?')
plt.xlabel('Cancellation Code')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-3m.csv')

# Create a pivot table to count the number of flights for each route
routes = data.pivot_table(index='ORIGIN', columns='DEST', values='FLIGHTS', aggfunc='sum')

# Create a heatmap of the pivot table
sns.heatmap(routes, cmap='Blues', annot=True, fmt='g', cbar_kws={'label': 'Number of Flights'})

# Set chart title and axis labels
plt.title('Distribution of Flight Routes')
plt.xlabel('Destination')
plt.ylabel('Origin')

# Rotate x-axis labels for legibility
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')

# Return plot object
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(8,6))
    carrier_counts = data['carrier'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(carrier_counts, labels=carrier_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of airline carriers?')
    return plt

data = pd.read_csv('flights-3m.csv')
chart = plot(data)
```
